p: In addition to being associated with HIV prevalence, heavy rainfall was associated with STIs and the number of sexual partners in the past 12 months, suggesting that an increase in the risk of sexual transmission could be at least partially responsible for the observed findings. Although the findings were significant, the relevance of many of the associations appears to be small to moderate. However, these associations may have public health and clinical relevance given that heavy rainfall is not uncommon and may become more frequent.
